efficiency.description: The conciseness of the solution and the use of the most efficient method to solve the problem.

accuracy.description: The correctness of the solution provided for the math problem.

completeness.description: The extent to which the solution covers all aspects of the problem.

clarity.description: The ease with which the solution can be understood by the target audience.

presentation.description: The organization and presentation of the solution, including proper use of notation, symbols, and formatting.

steps delineation.description: How well the solution breaks down the problem-solving process into smaller, manageable steps.

response time.description: The time taken to provide the solution

notations.description: The notations used in the problem solution are appropriate and consistent

step explanation.description: The extent to which each step in the solution is explained.

error handling.description: How well the system identifies and addresses possible errors in the problem

use of methods.description: The use of relevant techniques and concepts to address and solve the math problem.

level appropriateness.description: How well-suited the solution provided by the system is for the given problem's level

solution depth.description: The depth of the solution provided in terms of showing all steps and important calculations

terminology.description: Correct and consistent use of mathematical terminology in the explanations

reliability.description: The dependability of the procedure/algorithm used in providing the solution

calculation error.description: Presence of any computational or mathematical mistakes in the solution

creativity.description: Novel approach or method used in providing the solution

relevance.description: The solution should focus on solving the given problem and avoid irrelevant information or steps.

simplification.description: The degree to which the solution simplifies the problem while maintaining accuracy

handling constraints.description: The accuracy of the solution in addressing given constraints

problem type.description: The type of the math problem

adaptability.description: Adaptability refers to the ability of the solution provided to be modified and adjusted to alternative or related problems.

problem level.description: The difficulty level of the math problem

solution approach.description: Appropriateness of the solution approach used

correct reasoning.description: The extent to which the systems response demonstrates correct mathematical reasoning.
